g.text: kubectl taint: a way of tagging
use case: schedule pods that run together or avoid
deploy duplicated pods for high availability
- hard: must be satified - may not run if the
- soft: nice if satified but not critical - may run
even if the requirement is not met
trade-off: restrict schedule freedom for high
job: run a pod for specified number of times
daemon set: pod acts like an AGENT
that runs in each of the nodes
- labels: something meaningful for us, not for
- manage internal dns, load balancer with:
use alias, short tag, abbreviation resource
sets, stateful sets, replica sets, jobs
